meanings.definition: To secretly cooperate with others in order to commit a wrongdoing.
meanings.sent1: She connives with her friends to sneak out of the house at night.
meanings.sent2: The villains connive to steal the precious jewels from the museum.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat connives with the dog to steal treats from the pantry.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds connive with the wind to create a stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox connives with the clever rabbit to outsmart the farmer.

meanings.definition: To plot or scheme in a deceitful manner.
meanings.sent1: He connives to frame his rival for a crime he didn't commit.
meanings.sent2: The evil queen connives to take over the kingdom by any means necessary.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon connives to steal the shiny apples from the orchard.
meanings.sent4: The shadows connive with the silence to create an eerie atmosphere in the haunted house.
meanings.sent5: The wicked witch connives with the dark magic to cast a spell on the princess.
